intro: Empetrum rubrum f. falklandicum, commonly known as Falkland Fireweed, is a variant of the common fireweed native to the Falkland Islands. It is a low-growing evergreen shrub characterized by its dense clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in coastal and maritime environments, often found on sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and evergreen, providing year-round coverage. This subspecies is adapted to the harsh climate of the Southern Hemisphere, showing resilience to strong winds and salt spray.
